net.sytes.botg.array.math

Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sytes.botg.array.math.Mat

  • public class Mat
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double[][] distanceMatrix(double[][] points)
      computes the distance matrix for each point in points to all other points
      here points[][] is a 2D double array, where the first dimension is the number of rows and the 2nd dimension the number of features/coordinates of the points Example 1:
      if the distance between two Points P1 {1, 0} and P2 {1, 1} in 2D should be computed, points should look the following way:
      point[0][0] = 1;
      point[0][1] = 0;
      point[1][0] = 1;
      point[1][1] = 1; Example 2:
      distance between two Points P1 {1, 1, 2} and P2 {0, 2, 3} in 3D
      point[0][0] = 1;
      point[0][1] = 1;
      point[0][2] = 2;
      point[1][0] = 0;
      point[1][1] = 2;
      point[1][2] = 3; The result returned is a symmetric matrix D_ij, that reads in the following way:
      D_ij is the distance between Point i and Point j
      all values D_ii are 0 (reads: distance from Point i to Point i --> 0)
      static double[][] norm(double[][] x) 
      static double[][] zscore(double[][] x)
      normalization of vector x with zscore

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • distanceMatrix

        public static double[][] distanceMatrix(double[][] points)
        computes the distance matrix for each point in points to all other points
        here points[][] is a 2D double array, where the first dimension is the number of rows and the 2nd dimension the number of features/coordinates of the points
        Example 1:
        if the distance between two Points P1 {1, 0} and P2 {1, 1} in 2D should be computed, points should look the following way:
        point[0][0] = 1;
        point[0][1] = 0;
        point[1][0] = 1;
        point[1][1] = 1;
        Example 2:
        distance between two Points P1 {1, 1, 2} and P2 {0, 2, 3} in 3D
        point[0][0] = 1;
        point[0][1] = 1;
        point[0][2] = 2;
        point[1][0] = 0;
        point[1][1] = 2;
        point[1][2] = 3;
        The result returned is a symmetric matrix D_ij, that reads in the following way:
        D_ij is the distance between Point i and Point j
        all values D_ii are 0 (reads: distance from Point i to Point i --> 0)
        Parameters:
        points -
        Returns:
